Melvins - Houdini [1993]


\(\leftarrow\) Back to Music articles \(\leftarrow\)

( words)

Happy children. A bicephalic dog. LOS TICKA TOE REST!
Excuse me? What?

Yup. Welcome to the world of the Melvins.

Looking like a 1950s picture of US-American happy children playing in their backyard. - At least thats what my german mind thinks of what it might have looked like in the 50s in the USA.... Just happy and normal. Except, they are playing with a little bicephalic dog.
The Sound of The Melvins is exactly this dog. Probably, no certainly bigger, like Fluffy from Harry Potter (for the the little sorcerers in between us ;)). Mid-Tempo Riffs from King Buzzo and punching grooves from Dale Crover show you what it means to play in a Sludge band of the early days. The Bass section is played by Lori "Lorax" Black, daughter of Shirley Temple, with an obviously excellent taste in music. But, de gustibus non est disputandum, right? - Si! Y me gusta mucho, folks!

I could talk a little more about the history of the band and the backround of the album. Unfortunately, I just threw "Houdini" in again.

LOS TICKA TOE REST!

Next Up: Melvins - Lysol [1992]
